revised_title: Phytoplankton Production in Continental Shelf Seas: The Role of Axially Varying Vertical Mixing
tldr: This study investigates the role of axially varying vertical mixing in generating phytoplankton production in continental shelf seas. The authors demonstrate that a stratified shelf current passing through an area of intense tidal mixing can inject nutrients and create a larger area of high phytoplankton production throughout the summer. This process is significant for understanding the fluctuations in fish recruitment and the overall productivity of the continental shelf seas.
